title: Return json data in _force.py visualize method
body:
Hi all;

this is more a question than an issue. I've modified the **_force.py** file to return the json data and paint the plots in an "external" Frontend application.

As all of you know, there are two classes in _force.py used to paint the charts when you used shap.**force_plot** method.

Both classes, **AdditiveForceVisualizer** and **AdditiveForceArrayVisualizer** have a **html** method that is in charge of return the javascript with the React element used to paint the plot.

I added a new method (raw) just to return the json data using in my own ReactJs application that use the Visualizers React components from the IML package https://github.com/interpretable-ml/iml

```
    def raw(self, raw):
        if raw:
            return self.data
```

raw method will be called when raw param is True:
shap.force_plot(explainer.expected_value, shap_values[0,:], X.iloc[0,:], **raw=True**)

My question is ... do you think that would be useful to include this new method in shap repo?
